decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposed rear roof extension above the two-storey back addition, by reason of its style, scale, location and massing, is deemed an inappropriate and incongruous addition to the subject property and would cause undue visual harm to the character and appearance of the host property and the surrounding area. The proposal would cause undue harm to the amenity of surrounding residential occupiers in terms of being overbearing, overshadowing, creating an increased sense of enclosure and unsatisfactory outlook. The proposal would therefore fail to be in accordance with policies LP1, LP2 and LP5 of the Wandsworth Local Plan ((2023); policy D3 of the London Plan (2021); and the Local Plan 'Housing' SPD (2016).

Reason : 2 - In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application. We have made available detailed advice in the form of our statutory policies in the Local Plan consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre application advice service. However, we have been unable to seek solutions to problems as the principle of the proposal is clearly contrary to our statutory policies and negotiation could not overcome the reasons for refusal.
description: Alterations including erection of a dormer extension to main rear roof slope with French doors and safety railing, with erection of an extension above existing two-storey rear addition.
